comment:
According to the source, -da is a suffix of adjectives. It appears in all cardinals except the ones that end with ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½e-CM '1', including it itself [magomedovaabdulaeva2007: 686]. In fast colloquial speech class marker -CM is often omitted. Unlike in Southern Akhvakh, -da cannot be omitted [41]. Apparently, -da and class marker do not repeat in a complex numeral and appear only on the end of it [examples on page 71]. Ordinals inflect the way adjectives do [72]. =da appears in azaro-da '1000', as shown by [creisselsdraft2020: 17] (no mentions of millions and larger). The -da-CM-e might originate in participle ida-CM-e 'being' [67].
Confusion: [magomedbekova1967: 41] mentions that in Southern Akhvakh cardinals do not inflect by class. It is unclear whether she means that the -CM-e suffix is absent in these cardinals. No examples are given. [creisselsdraft2020: 16], however, mentions the same thing (-CM is absent) but attributes this feature to Northern Akhvakh. ffix. Also, [creisselsdraft2020: 17] shows examples of ordinals without the class marker which is present in [magomedovaabdulaeva2007: 687]. This problem needs help.
example_comment:
transcription and glossing need revision
glossing -da as NUM, but worth mentioning that the source says it is adjective suffix [magomedbekova1967: 40]. [creisselsdraft2020: 10] says that 'no particular function can be attributed' to it.

comment: This is 'class form'. It is marked by a-CM-u when the short form (stem) ends with a consonant, and by ej-CM-u when it ends with a vowel. Exception: qI'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½e 'two' makes class forms qI'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ewu (I), qI'ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½eru (II). Also, os '1' does not receive class marker but it has a special form when impure: sej-CM-u (for example, in '31') [mikailov1967: 74]. There is also a so-called ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½full formï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ of a cardinal, which is derived from the stem with the suffix -(tï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½)or, which is plural marker for substantives. Units do not have this marker (it is said that the short form, a.k.a stem, and the full form of cardinals coincide for units.) -or is ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½characteristicï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½s do not preserve emphatic meaning.

In morpheme -ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Iï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½-ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, which marks numerals 30ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½90, class marker is frozen as -r (ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½-ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½Iï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½-ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ '50' glossed as 'five-ten-CM'). However, [magometov1965: 160] is rather inconsistent in terms of whether class marker here is frozen or not. In hundreds, class marker is attached to the number of ýý. Numerals ýýýýýýýý '100' and ýýýýýýýýýýýý '1000' do not inflect by class. (Unclear if they used to, probably notýýý) In dialects of Tabasaran there are differences in inflection of numerals. When substantivized, cardinals inflect by case like nouns. Class marker is present, case suffixes attach after it [magometov1965: 160].

value1_name: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
feature: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
comment: There is a frozen class marker -d, which does not appear in adnominal positions. Many numerals also have frozen class markers in prefixes: j-/b-/w- [52]. Starting with 30, all numerals ending with tens, hundreds, etc. have -r instead of -d [96]. Class marker does not repeat [97]. Final class marker appears in substantivized forms only. In attributive positions class is omitted. When substantivized, cardinals inflect by case. If a class marker is present, it is omitted and replaced by -ji in oblique forms (followed by case suffixes), if there was no class marker, oblique suffix -a is attached before case suffixes (-di for millions). Substantivized cardinals can take plural forms with -ar [98].

value1_name: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
feature: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
comment: There is a frozen class marker -r, which does not appear in adnominal positions [52]. It is present in Burshag idiom, whereas in other auls the marker is frozen as -d. Class marker does not repeat [97]. Final class marker appears in substantivized forms only. In attributive positions class is omitted. When substantivized, cardinals inflect by case. If a class marker is present, it is omitted and replaced by -ji in oblique forms (followed by case suffixes), if there was no class marker, oblique suffix -a is attached before case suffixes (-di for millions). Substantivized cardinals can take plural forms with -ar [98].

But =CM is also used in denoting the number of hundreds, thousands, etc. (for example, q'oI=d walï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ '200'). value1_name: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
feature: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
comment: Class markers for class I and II coincide (-r). Numerals ending with units, 10, 20, or 100 have class marker. Class marker is repeated to denote the number of the hundreds (and agrees with the word 'hundred' itself). Same for thousands [149]. When substantivized, in oblique cases the marker is supposedly absent (sun.dï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

value1_name: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
feature: Presence of a class suffix in the numeral marker
comment: ýýLes numýýraux ýýpithýýtes sýýýaccordent ýý lýýýabsolutif: sa-r furi ýýýun hommeýýý ; sab xinib ýýýune femmeýýý = sab barkan ýýýun chevalýýý = sab kýýýul ýýýune maisonýýý; sad yiýý ýýýun jourýýý; mais nýýýont quýýýune forme ýý partir du gýýnitif quels que soient le cas et le genre: sunci fura, sunci xinibci, sunci barkanci, sunci kýýýulci, sunci yiýýinýý. Cardinals have an oblique form which is originally genitive (for example, sab xinib ýýýone womanýýý => sunci xinibci). In oblique form (apparently, both attributive and substantivized), class marker is replaced by oblique marker -ci ('1' and '2' have special oblique forms.) Class marker repeats: ýýibqaýýa-r-na-yitsýýý-ir '70' (as in sixty-CM-ADD-ten-CM). 1000 does not have class marker, apparently.
